title: Musicians needed - join Tinley Park Community Band
description: One of your neighbors posted in Neighbor News. Click through to read what they have to say. (The views expressed in this post are the author’s own.)
content:
The Tinley Park Community Band, directed by Barbara Abarro, is in its 38th year of making music. Musicians are invited to join this 45+ piece concert band. All instruments are welcome. The Tinley Park Jazz Band, directed by Robert Good was formed around 1990.

The Tinley Park Community Band and Jazz Band are active year-round sharing their talents and bringing the sound of live concert band and jazz music to Tinley Park and surrounding communities. The band was established in 1987 and performs throughout the Chicagoland area. Many of these concerts are free or have a very low admission fee, making an afternoon or evening of live music affordable and family-friendly. The band performs a wide ranging repertoire, including marches, show tunes, popular songs, contemporary compositions and classical band literature. Members come from all over the Chicagoland suburbs.

The Concert Band also represents the Village of Tinley Park. It made successful tours to Germany in 1994 and 2000 as part of the Tinley Park-Büdingen Sister Cities cultural exchange program. In 2004, the band represented the State of Illinois at ceremonies surrounding the dedication of the National World War II Memorial in Washington D.C. The Jazz Band has performed at the Illinois State Fair on several occasions. They’ve also performed in Toronto, Canada.

keywords.name: live concert band and jazz music

summary: The Tinley Park Community Band, directed by Barbara Abarro, is in its 38th year and members are encouraged to join the band. The band, which performs free and low-cost performances throughout the country, has a wide-ranging repertoire of songs and performances. It has also represented the state of Illinois at ceremonies surrounding the dedication of the National World War II Memorial.
shortSummary: The Tinley Park Community Band, led by Barbara Abro, is seeking volunteers for their 38th anniversary celebrations, featuring performances from across the board.
argos_summary: The Tinley Park Community Band, now in its 38th year under conductor Barbara Abarro, welcomes musicians of all instruments to its 45‑plus piece concert ensemble, while the Tinley Park Jazz Band, directed by Robert Good since around 1990, offers a complementary jazz experience. Both groups perform year‑round across the Chicagoland area, offering free or low‑fee concerts that feature a wide range of repertoire from marches to contemporary works. They have represented Tinley Park on international tours to Germany in 1994 and 2000, performed at the National World War II Memorial in Washington, D.C. in 2004, and the Jazz Band has appeared at the Illinois State Fair and in Toronto, Canada.
